subtasks: Open seed packet.
Hold seed packet upright.
Pour seeds into a container.
Measure out correct amount of seeds.
Mix seeds with fertilizer (if required).
Ensure seeds are uniformly spread in the container.
Measure and mark row spacing.
Dig a shallow furrow along the row.
Gently place seeds into the furrow at appropriate depth.
Cover seeds with soil, tamping gently to ensure good contact.
Water the planted rows.
Identify weeds among crops.
Grip weeds near the base.
Pull weeds out from the soil.
Discard weeds properly.
Walk through the field.
Observe crops for signs of disease or pests.
Note any areas needing additional water or attention.
Load hay into the baler feed.
Compress the hay into a bale.
Disconnect the bale from the baler and secure it.
Repeat process for additional bales.

tasks.task: Drive a tractor equipped with a plow.
subtasks: Start the tractor engine.
Adjust the plow's depth and angle.
Operate the hydraulic controls for plowing.
Navigate the tractor along the planned planting rows.
Stop periodically to check plow operation.
Attach the combine to the tractor.
Position the combine in the start row.
Begin cutting the crop, letting the combine separate the grain.
Navigate the combine through the field, driving in a straight line.
Check the grain bin for fullness; unload when necessary.
Continue harvesting until the field is complete.
Use a disc harrow to break up soil.
Smooth the soil surface with a roller.
Set up irrigation systems if required.
Apply necessary fertilizers or pesticides.
Wait for optimal planting conditions.
